2:
I will say to God, 'Do not merely condemn me;\q show me why you accuse me.
\q
3:
Is it good to you that you should oppress me,\q to despise the work of your hands
\q while you smile on the plans of the wicked?


\q
4:
Do you have eyes of flesh?\q Do you see like a man sees?
\q
5:
Are your days like the days of mankind\q or your years like the years of people,
\q
6:
that you inquire after my iniquity\q and search after my sin,
\q
7:
although you know I am not guilty\q and there is no one who can rescue me from your hand?
\m


\q
8:
Your hands have framed and fashioned me\q together round about, yet you are destroying me.
\q
9:
Call to mind, I beg you, that you have fashioned me like clay;\q will you bring me into dust again?


\q
10:
Have you not poured me out like milk\q and curdled me like cheese?
\q
11:
You have clothed me with skin and flesh\q and knit me together with bones and sinews.


\q
12:
You have granted me life and covenant faithfulness;\q your help has guarded my spirit.
\q
13:
Yet these things you hid in your heartâ€”\q I know that this is what you were thinking:
\q
14:
that if I sinned, you would notice it;\q you would not acquit me of my iniquity.


\q
15:
If I am wicked, woe to me;\q even if I were righteous, I could not lift up my head,
\q since I am filled with disgrace
\q and am looking at my own suffering.
\q
16:
If my head lifts itself, you hunt me down like a lion;\q once again you show yourself powerful to me.


\q
17:
You bring new witnesses against me\q and increase your anger against me;
\q you attack me with fresh armies.
\m


\q
18:
Why, then, have you brought me out of the womb?\q I wish I had given up my spirit and that no eye had ever seen me.
\q
19:
I would have been as though I had never existed;\q I would have been carried from the womb to the grave.


\q
20:
Are not my days only a few? Stop then,\q let me alone, so that I may have a little rest
\q
21:
before I go from where I will not return,\q to the land of darkness and of the shadow of death,
\q
22:
the land that is as dark as midnight,\q the land of the shadow of death, without any order,
\q where the light is like midnight.'"
